io.odysz.semantics

Interface ISemantext


  • public interface ISemantext
    Interface for Semantic Event Handler

    In short, an ISemantext is the statement runtime context for building sql.

    A semantic event can be for example starting an insert transaction with a data row. Such data may needing some processing defined by the application requirements.

    For example, a "fullpath" field in a table means a deep first traveling notation of tree nodes.

    In this case, a user defined semantic event handler can compose this data (fullpath) according to it's parent's fullpath, then append the field into the inserting row.

    Semantic-transact is designed only process SQL structure, not handling the data semantics, so it only fire the event to the handler, to the implementation of ISemantext.

    An ISemantext instance is used as an sql composing context by semantic-transact when travel the AST and composing SQL(s). There must be an insert(io.odysz.transact.sql.Insert, java.lang.String, io.odysz.semantics.IUser...) event which fired at the beginning of composing an insert sql, and one event for inserting each row, the onInsert(io.odysz.transact.sql.Insert, java.lang.String, java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]>>).

    Author:
    odys-z@github.com

      • insert

        ISemantext insert(Insert insert,
                  String mainTabl,
                  IUser... usr)

        Create a context for the insert-sql composing process.

        Called when starting an inserting transaction's sql composing.

        The parameter usr is optional if the semantics handler don't care about user's fingerprint.

        Parameters:
        insert -
        mainTabl -
        usr - user information used for modify sql AST
        Returns:
        the new ISemantext context instance for resolving semantics.

      • update

        ISemantext update(Update update,
                  String mainTabl,
                  IUser... usr)

        Create a context for the update-sql composing process.

        Called when starting an update transaction sql composing.

        The parameter usr is optional if the semantics handler don't care about user's fingerprint.

        Parameters:
        update -
        mainTabl -
        usr - user information used for modify sql AST
        Returns:
        new ISemantext for update statement

      • onInsert

        ISemantext onInsert(Insert insert,
                    String tabl,
                    List<ArrayList<Object[]>> rows)
             throws TransException

        Resolving inserting values, e.g an AUTO key is generated here.

        Called each time an <@link Insert} statement found itself will composing a insert-sql (Insert.sql(ISemantext))

        Parameters:
        insert -
        tabl -
        rows - [ list[Object[n, v], ... ], ... ]
        Returns:
        the ISemantext context, a thread safe context for resolving semantics like FK value resolving.
        Throws:
        SemanticException
        TransException

      • genId

        String genId(String tabl,
             String col)
      throws SQLException,
             TransException
        Generate an auto increasing ID for tabl.col, where connection is initialized when constructing this implementation.
        The new generated value is managed in this implementation class (for future resolving).
        side effect: generated auto key already been put into autoVals, can be referenced later.
        Parameters:
        tabl -
        col -
        Returns:
        new auto key.
        Throws:
        SQLException
        TransException

      • onCommitted

        void onCommitted(ISemantext ctx,
                 String tabl)
          throws TransException,
                 SQLException

        When the commitment succeeded, there are still things must be done, like deleting external files.

        The operations which are (instances of Statement.IPostOperat lambda expression, are pushed into semantext while handling semantics, via #addOnRowsCommitted(IPostOperat) & #addOnTableCommitted(String, IPostOperat).
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        tabl -
        Throws:
        TransException
        SQLException

      • onSelected

        void onSelected(Object resultset)
         throws SQLException,
                TransException
        On selected event handler, the chance that the resultset can be modified.
        Parameters:
        resultset - any result object that can be understood by handler. e.g. SResultSet
        Throws:
        SQLException - iterating on resultset failed
        TransException - handling failed

      • hasOnSelectedHandler

        boolean hasOnSelectedHandler(String name)
        Check is an operator already exists.
        Parameters:
        name - handler name
        Returns:
        true if has the named operator

      • addOnSelectedHandler

        void addOnSelectedHandler(String name,
                          Statement.IPostSelectOperat op)
        Add an post selected operation.

        E.g. extFile Funcall will add a post file reading and replacing operation here.

        Only one type of handler can be added to a context. Use hasOnSelectedHandler(String) to check is there a same type of handler already been added.

        Operations are managed as a linked hash map. All rows are iterated and processed by op one by one, from first to last, independently.

        For each row, operations are iterated in the order of been added.

        Parameters:
        op -

      • composeVal

        AbsPart composeVal(Object v,
                   String tabl,
                   String col)

        Compose the v provide by client into target table column's value represented in sql, whether add single quote or not.

        If v is an instance of string, add "'" according to db type; if it is an instance of AbsPart, return it directly.

        The null/empty values are handled differently according data meta.
        See the discussions.
        Parameters:
        v -
        tabl -
        col -
        Returns:
        the composed value object

      • reset

        ISemantext reset()
        Reset resulves
        Returns:
        this
